description: Construction of a detached two storey, 6 bedroom dwellinghouse with habitable accomodation in roofspace including one dormer to the front roofslope and two dormers to the rear roofslope; provision for landscaping and parking (following demolition of existing detached two storey residential building)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Existing Block Plan 293NR P101, Proposed Block Plan 293NR P102 rev A, Existing Floor Plans 293NR P103, Proposed Elevations 293NR P104, Proposed Floor Plans 293NR P105 rev B, Proposed Elevations 293NR P106 rev B and Aboricultural Report for 293 Norwood Road (ref. 11474), dated 24th October 2011, by K. MacGregor received 13th February 2012.   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' and London Plan Policies 7.4 and 7.6. | The window to be fitted at first floor level on the side elevation facing no.295 shall be fixed and obscurely glazed and shall be maintained as such thereafter.   REASON: To ensure the privacy of neighbouring properties is maintained in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, Plan for the Environment (2004) and London Plan Policies 7.4 and 7.6. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Part 1 Classes A to E of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008 no enlargement, improvement or alteration, extensions or alterations to the roof, porches, or outbuildings shall be carried out to the dwelling hereby permitted without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the dwellings hereby approved, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and London Plan Policies 7.4 and 7.6. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended 2008), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and London Plan Policies 7.4 and 7.6. | The development hereby approved shall adhere to the submitted 'Aboricultural Report for 293 Norwood Road' (ref. 11474), dated 24th October 2011, by K. MacGregor and ' all operations shall strictly follow the detailed statement and protection measures comply with BS5837:2005.    REASON: - In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity of the area in accordance with policy 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, Plan for the Environment (2004) and London Plan policy 7.21. | No development (including initial site clearance) shall commence until details of a site construction method statement and management plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:  1) on-site construction worker parking 2) anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles  3) delivery times 4) vehicle manoeuvring 5) details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices 6) procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents. 7) a programme of supervision/monitoring for all arboricultural protection measures 8) location details of all below ground service runs, where services enter the root protection area of the Horse Chestnut Tree to be retained.  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and occupiers of the neighbouring sites and ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 4.4, 4.5, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and London Plan (2011) Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.21. | Details of boundary treatment and internal enclosures to be constructed or retained including the position, design and materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The boundary treatment shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.   Reason:  To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and London Plan (2011) Policies 7.4 and 7.6. | The dwelling hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes standards, unless otherwise agreed to in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure the development provides access for all future occupiers and meets Lifetime Homes Standards in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: 'Accessible Ealing'. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details of the insulation of the building envelope with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The insulation shall achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms. The works shall be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupants in accordance with policy 4.11 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and London Plan (2011) Policy 7.15. | Prior to occupation of the dwellinghouse hereby approved, details of refuse storage facilities shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details.  Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interest of the environment, in accordance with and policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and London Plan (2011) Policy 3.5. | Prior to commencement of the development, details of the glazed staircase feature shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.   Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and London Plan (2011) Policies 7.4 and 7.6.
